alert.note: Alert for Hillsborough (New Hampshire) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 23 at 4:13PM EST until December 24 at 1:52AM EST by NWS Gray/Portland
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Gray ME has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in New Hampshire... Piscataquog River NEAR Goffstown affecting Hillsborough County. For the PISCATAQUOG RIVER...including Goffstown...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL JUST AFTER MIDNIGHT TONIGHT... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Piscataquog River near Goffstown. * WHEN...Until just after midnight tonight. * IMPACTS...At 9.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding begins. At 11.0 feet, Flooding begins near the village of Riverdale and areas below Glen Lake. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 8.7 feet. - Forecast...The river will rise above flood stage this evening to 9.1 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage this evening to 5.9 feet and begin rising again Sunday evening. It will rise to 6.4 feet Monday morning. It will then fall again and remain below flood stage. - Flood stage is 9.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/gray.
